title: Sulli dead: f(x) Victoria hits out at trolls after bandmate's death
text:
Victoria was in fx with Sulli for five years (Picture: Han Myung-Gu/WireImage)

f(x) star Victoria has lashed out at trolls in the wake of the death of her friend Sulli.

The 32-year-old spoke out on Sulli’s death aged 25 yesterday, saying ‘goodbye’ to her former bandmate in a heartfelt message.

And now, the K-pop star has called on trolls to stop creating rumours and commenting on other people’s lives on social media.

In a translation from the original Chinese post on China’s social platform Weibo by Soompi, Victoria questioned why social media has become ‘the ruler’.

The Electric Shock singer wrote: ‘Since when have Weibo, WeChat, and Instagram become the rulers? The rulers by which we measure ethics, people’s relationships, emotions, anything that people wish to measure.

Victoria called out cruel commenters on social media (Picture: Han Myung-Gu/WireImage)

‘A public platform is a place where you can share things with others. When did it become a place to put on a show? You can post if you want, and if you don’t want to, you don’t have to. There is no empathy, just yourself.

‘If you want to see a show, then shout. If you want to create rumours, keep at it. I’m not extraordinary. I just want to live my life more grounded in reality than the people leaving comments.’

Victoria continued: ‘Don’t speculate. If you have time to come up with a story, what do you think about spending that time doing something more meaningful? Please don’t let [commenting and social media] become your life. You can’t find your identity in a world that’s made up of falsehoods. People need to take walks through reality. Please don’t waste your time.

Sulli is suspected to have taken her own life (Picture: EPA/YONHAP)

‘Please don’t tell others what they need to do with their lives. Even well-intentioned advice has its boundaries. Don’t overstep. What right do you have to tell a stranger to do this, or don’t do that, when your own life is a wreck? Everyone’s life is different and unique. Who has the right to tell someone else how to live?

‘Focus on your own life. Live in the present. If you live with a kind heart, that is enough.’

This comes after Sulli, who was in f(x) alongside Victoria from 2009 until 2015, died aged 25 by suspected suicide.

The singer, real name Choi Jin-ri, had previously struggled with receiving abuse online, even going on hiatus from f(x) in 2014 due to the trolling.

Sulli was the MC of the JTBC show Night of Hate Comments, where she read out all the mean comments written about her online.

Following her death, lawmakers in Korea have reportedly proposed a bill called Sulli’s Act to tackle cyber-bullying.
